docs.snippet: BP Plc rejoined bidders for exploration and production leases in the Gulf of Mexico on Wednesday and won 24 tracts after the U.S. government lifted a 16-month ban barring the company from new federal contracts....

headline.main: BP Bids in Gulf of Mexico Lease Sale After U.S. Lifts Ban
headline.print_headline: BP Bids in Gulf of Mexico Lease Sale After U.S. Lifts Ban

docs.lead_paragraph: BP Plc rejoined bidders for exploration and production leases in the Gulf of Mexico on Wednesday and won 24 tracts after the U.S. government lifted a 16-month ban barring the company from new federal contracts.

docs.snippet: C.J. Fair was a loser on Senior Day in the Carrier Dome and in the only Atlantic Coast Conference tournament game he'll ever play. Enough already for Syracuse's smooth-shooting swingman....

headline.main: Syracuse Faces Western Michigan in NCAA Tournament
headline.print_headline: Syracuse Faces Western Michigan in NCAA Tournament

docs.lead_paragraph: C.J. Fair was a loser on Senior Day in the Carrier Dome and in the only Atlantic Coast Conference tournament game he'll ever play. Enough already for Syracuse's smooth-shooting swingman.

headline.print_headline: Acclaimed Singer Emmylou Harris to Write Memoir

docs.snippet: The parallels between the handling of vehicle defects by Toyota and General Motors are striking, Peter J. Henning writes in the White Collar Watch column....

headline.main: Toyota Settlement Blazes Path for G.M.

docs.abstract: The parallels between the handling of vehicle defects by Toyota and General Motors are striking, Peter J. Henning writes in the White Collar Watch column.

docs.snippet: Sen. Dianne Feinstein on Wednesday joined Gov. Jerry Brown in expressing skepticism about legalizing marijuana in California for recreational purposes....

headline.main: AP Interview: Feinstein Against Legalizing Pot
headline.print_headline: AP Interview: Feinstein Against Legalizing Pot

docs.lead_paragraph: Sen. Dianne Feinstein on Wednesday joined Gov. Jerry Brown in expressing skepticism about legalizing marijuana in California for recreational purposes.

docs.snippet: British regulators are examining evidence relating to a 2012 meeting of currency dealers and Bank of England officials which potentially challenges the central bank's assertion it had not condoned sharing details of client orders....

headline.main: Exclusive: Chatroom Evidence Questions BoE Role in FX Probe-Sources
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Chatroom Evidence Questions BoE Role in FX Probe-Sources

docs.lead_paragraph: British regulators are examining evidence relating to a 2012 meeting of currency dealers and Bank of England officials which potentially challenges the central bank's assertion it had not condoned sharing details of client orders.

docs.snippet: J.A. Happ gave up three runs, three hits and four walks over 2 2-3 innings, but Jose Bautista bailed him out, hitting two homers to lead the Toronto Blue Jays over the Philadelphia Phillies 11-6 Wednesday....

headline.main: Happ Struggles in Jays' 11-6 Win Over Phils
headline.print_headline: Happ Struggles in Jays' 11-6 Win Over Phils

docs.lead_paragraph: J.A. Happ gave up three runs, three hits and four walks over 2 2-3 innings, but Jose Bautista bailed him out, hitting two homers to lead the Toronto Blue Jays over the Philadelphia Phillies 11-6 Wednesday.

docs.snippet: The son of Equatorial Guinea's president has been put under formal investigation in France for money laundering, his lawyer said on Wednesday....

headline.main: France Puts Equatorial Guinea Leader's Son Under Formal Investigation
headline.print_headline: France Puts Equatorial Guinea Leader's Son Under Formal Investigation

docs.lead_paragraph: The son of Equatorial Guinea's president has been put under formal investigation in France for money laundering, his lawyer said on Wednesday.

docs.snippet: A year after a fire killed eight children when it ripped through a Koranic school in Senegal, the government has failed to prosecute those responsible and to halt the abuse of young boys in Islamic education, Human Rights Watch said on Wednesday....

headline.main: Senegal Failing on Pledge to Halt Abuse in Koranic Schools: HRW
headline.print_headline: Senegal Failing on Pledge to Halt Abuse in Koranic Schools: HRW

docs.lead_paragraph: A year after a fire killed eight children when it ripped through a Koranic school in Senegal, the government has failed to prosecute those responsible and to halt the abuse of young boys in Islamic education, Human Rights Watch said on Wednesday.

docs.snippet: Molly Wood offers tips for parents to make their tablets and smartphones more child-friendly before handing them over....
